programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the experts pay a visit to Newstead Abbey. Among the discoveries are a medal for bravery awarded to a pigeon in World War Two.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team arrive at Towneley Hall near Burnley in Lancashire. Despite heavy rain, thousands arrive to show their family treasures.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.sub-title: The Scottish Gallery of Modern Art 1
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team head to Scotland where a large crowd awaits the experts at the National Gallery of Modern Art in Edinburgh.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: We discover the tantalising stories about what happened to antiques and their owners once the Roadshow cameras have stopped rolling.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team visit Richmond Park in London where they meet visitors bringing their family treasures at the Royal Ballet School.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and team head to the University of East Anglia where they are joined by huge crowds in the shadow of the Sainsbury Centre for Visual Arts.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce heads to Exeter Cathedral. Objects under inspection include a table reputed to have been used by Bonnie Prince Charlie.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: A visit to Scone Palace, near Perth in Scotland, sees Fiona Bruce and the team meeting thousands of visitors bringing precious heirlooms.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The first of two specials marking the centenary of the outbreak of World War I. Fiona Bruce travels to the poignant Thiepval Memorial.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the experts pay a return visit to the Royal Agricultural University at Cirencester in the Cotswolds.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the antiques experts pay a return visit to Polesden Lacey near Dorking in Surrey for one of the busiest days in Roadshow history.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the experts are at Gregynog in Wales at the former home of the wealthy Davies sisters, who helped bring art to the people of Wales.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: A Jolly Roger flag counts among the family treasures presented to the Roadshow team in a return visit to Southsea.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.sub-title: The Scottish National Gallery of Modern Art 2
programme.desc: A sketchbook believed to have been made on the journey from England to Australia in 1851 aboard the S.S. Great Britain is brought in for inspection.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the experts visit the Royal Ballet School in Richmond Park where they find a table purportedly made from the Old London Bridge.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Objects in this episode include a rare 18th-century glass bought for 10p from a charity shop and a pair of Queen Victoria's amazingly large knickers.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the experts travel to Wentworth Woodhouse, a palace in south Yorkshire where they encounter a bureau once owned by Earl Fitzwilliam.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Objects under inspection include a special medal awarded for kindness to pit ponies and a valuable painted Georgian tea tray.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK Detectives
programme.desc: Graham Lay investigates an embroidered tablecloth. Covered in signatures it was made by female prisoners in a Japanese internment camp during the 2nd World War.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The show's 35th year is marked by a very special visit from Her Majesty the Queen.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The Antiques Roadshow visits Kirby Hall in Northamptonshire.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: The Antiques Roadshow is back among the ruins of Kirby Hall in Northamptonshire.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow UK
programme.desc: Treasures featured include Chinese objects which revealed a shocking family secret and rare artworks by the sculptor Elisabeth Frink.
